chapter.title: Vouchers
chapter.para: Voucher products can be created in onCourse, and then offered for sale either via the College website or through the office via Quick Enrol. These vouchers can be gift certificates, a way to sell a bundle of enrolments as a set fee, or as a method of issuing a student with a credit, allowing them to apply that credit to an open or restricted range of courses.

listitem.para: A voucher product for sale for a user specified dollar value. Redemption value is the same as the purchase price and has a fixed redemption period e.g. 12 months. This type of voucher is typically known as a gift certificate.

A voucher product for sale for a different redemption price to the purchase price. e.g. purchase price $100, redemption value $120. This type of voucher can then be used as credit to purchase enrolments or other products.
A voucher product offered for sale for a fixed fee, redeemable for a single enrolment in a course or set of courses

A voucher product offered for sale for a fixed fee a fixed number of enrolments from a set of one or more courses. For example 4 enrolments from one course (a year's worth of enrolments in a course) or 4 enrolments in 4 courses (one enrolment in each of the four courses).

A way to sell a bundle of enrolments to a company for a fixed fee, for their staff to enrol in a class of their choice from a course, e.g. 10 enrolments in your choice of class for the course Computers for Beginners. This type of voucher would send the invoice on redemption to the nominated company contact, rather than to the student.

A voucher is a product which can be sold and later redeemed for other purchases or enrolments. Vouchers can be redeemed for a monetary value or for a fixed number of enrolments in a set range of courses. The voucher type describes how much the voucher costs to purchase, how long it is valid for and what it can be redeemed for.

Vouchers are the list of purchased voucher type products. Vouchers can be purchased and redeemed through Quick Enrol. This list shows who purchaed the voucher, who it is redeemable by and what the remaining value of the voucher includes. Every voucher has a unique code that must be quoted for redemption.

section.title: Issuing a Voucher
section.para: For most cases when a user wants to buy a voucher, they will nominate the price they wish to purchase the voucher for, and that the price will also be the redemption value of the voucher. (Type 1) This type of voucher product will be created by default for all onCourse instances and be called "Gift certificate". It will only be enabled if the College has the right license that enables this feature.

In addition, colleges can create other types of voucher products that are linked to enrolment permissions and these will have purchase prices fixed by the college. Some of these types of voucher products may also be available for sale on the website.

A voucher may be sold as part of the existing QE process or it may be given away for free (sold with 100% discount). Either way, an email is sent to the payer with the details of that voucher (not the student since it may be a gift, if the student and the payer are different people).

listitem.para: A student can click on the link in the voucher email (the URL contains the voucher code) www.collegeurl.com.au/enrol?voucher=[voucherproduct.code]
If the voucher is linked to the student, then it will be visible in their portal
A student can type in the voucher code in the payment window (as part of the redesigned enrolment page).

section.title: General
section.para:
To view, edit ot create a voucher type you can go to either the splash screen and click on Voucher type box in the Marketing tab or the onCourse menu File → Preferences → Voucher type.
View of the general tab in a new voucher type record
There are a number of fields in this tab, they are:
SKU - this refers to a stock-keeping unit, a unique identifier for each distinct product and service that can be purchased. You can create whatever product code you want for this voucher.
Name - allows you to name the voucher.
Liability Account - allows you to choose the liability account you want to be used.
Expiry date - this allows you to create a expiry date for the voucher for the date of purchase e.g. 365 days.
Options for redeement - you can select whether you want the voucher to be able to be redeemed for an enrolment/s, for the purchased price or for different price.
View of the general tab if the option for redeement is left with the default option "enrolment in"

itemizedlist.para: By clicking on the + button you open up a window thats gives you three options to choose what course/s the voucher can be redeemed against, they are:

listitem.para: Course - allows you to choose a specific course that the voucher can be redeemed against
All courses tagged with - allows you to choose a group of courses that have the same tag
All enabled courses - allows you to use this voucher for any course available

note.para: If you want to apply a voucher to more than one specifc course then you can use the first option "Course" one by one for each course.

section.title: Web
section.para:
This tab allows you to choose if this voucher is available to be purchased, by what methods, and if you wish to include any text on your website about it.
There are two checkboxes on this tab, they are:
Can be purchased online - allows people to to buy this voucher on your website
Is on sale - means this is now avaiable to be purchased
If only the "Is on sale" checkbox is selected then the voucher can only be puchased via the phone or over the counter.
You can also add a more indepth description that will be displayed on the website (as long as both checkboxes are selected) in the Web desciption field.
